Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" for Imperial Japanese Army Urged 
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The 721st Wednesday rally for the settlement of the issue of "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army took place in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on August 9, according to south Korean Internet radio "Voice of People".
 Speakers at the rally said that the issue of "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army is obviously a crime of violence against women and denounced the Japanese government for making no apology and compensation for it.    
 A statement read out at the rally stressed that the people will strengthen solidarity with the progressive forces of the world to get the Japanese government to apologize and compensate to the victims of the "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army.

articles.content:
Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Korean Revolution Museum 
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here visited the Korean Revolution Museum on August 14 on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 At the Hall for the Period of Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle the guests looked round with keen interest documentary photos, relics and data on display, being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung set forth the original Songun revolutionary idea and line and led the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to a brilliant victory and thus achieved the historical cause of liberation of the country.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
"Mosfilm" Week Opens 
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- A week for "Mosfilm" of Russia opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cinema House on August 14.
 Present there were Jo Chan Gu, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of culture and art and working people in Pyongyang.
 Also present there were a delegation of the Russian Federal State Unitary Enterprise "Cinema Concern 'Mosfilm'" led by its First Deputy General Director Vladimir Ryassov, Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and members of the Russian embassy. 
 Speeches were made there.    
 Then the participants saw a Russian feature film.

Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on August 14 on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the liberation of Korea and the completion of the Jongbaek Church.
 Present there on invitation were Jang Jae On, chairman of the Korean Council of Religionists, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ho Il Jin, chairman of the Korean Orthodox Church Committee, and officials concerned.    
 Also present there were members of the delegation of the Russian Orthodox Church led by its Chairman of the Office for Foreign Relations Kirill, patriarch of Smolensk and Kaliningrad Regions, and staff members of the Russian embassy.
 Speeches were made there.

Greetings to Russian President
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to V. V. Putin, president of the Russian Federation, on August 15, the 61st anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The message wished the Russian president success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the bilateral relations will develop in the spirit of the state-to-state treaty and joint declarations.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Guest
    Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the chairman of the Office for Foreign Relations of the Russian Orthodox Church who is also patriarch of Smolensk and Kaliningrad Regions on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by Patriarch Kirill on Tuesday.
